article_title: David Albright and Bruno Tertrais: Making Iran Come Clean About Its Nukes
article_text:
Iran's Atomic Energy Organization announced late last month that it intends to compile a "comprehensive document" listing all of the country's nuclear work. Yet the announcement said nothing about the crucial question: whether Iran has worked on nuclear weapons. Despite great expectations by its negotiating partners—meeting again this week in Vienna—that Tehran would clear up suspicions about its past and possibly current nuclear-weapons development, Iran has so far clarified little.

Alarm bells should be going...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, David Albright and Bruno Tertrais write that there is no point of striking an agreement with Iran if Tehran will be able to hide its weapons work.
twitter.title: Making Iran Come Clean About Its Nukes

image.alt: Making Iran Come Clean About Its Nukes
